Description: Rim and wall fragment of East Greek pottery plate. Medium-fine, reddish-brown (5 YR 6/4) clay with a small amount of silver mica and some white inclusions. Glaze partially fired red; yellowish grey slip on inside. Outside of rim glazed, meander hook frieze on top; on the floor, bands. Underside reserved with bands. Late Wild Goat Style.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

D. Piekarski, "Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akad. Mus. Bonn" in U.Hoekmann and D.Kreikenbom, Naukratis. Die Beziehungen zu Ostgriechenland, Aegypten und Zypern in archaischer Zeit, Acts of Round Table in Mainz (25-27 November 1999), Bibliopolis 2001, p. 99 pl. 12.1. Piekarski 2001 / p. 25 no. A17 pl. 5.1
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 25 no. A17 pl. 5.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1200)
